testsgen.doclet
Class UnitTestsGen

java.lang.Object
  testsgen.doclet.UnitTestsGen

public class UnitTestsGen
extends java.lang.Object

UnitTestsGen.java is Java SUN Doclet implementation class. It uses information provided by source code parser, uses special set of tags and generates code of test classes for unit testing. However in contrary to previous UnitTestsGen implementations it generates not only test classes framework with empty test methods but also real test code.

Tags definition
Tags defined bellow can be used only for class and method javadoc comments. If used for fields will be ignored.

  1. @unittest on|off -- optional tag. When ommited on is assumed. It is optional tag.
  2. @unittest_code "Comments for following test code." 
       [Put here java code suitable for perform some test]
   return true|false;
    As you can see whole test code should be finished with return boolean statement which gives information if test was finished with success or not. You can repeat this tag instance as many times as necessary for performing many tests on this method.
  3. @unittest_params param1, param2, param3 -- comma separated list of params required for given method.
  4. @unittest_expect value -- value expected as a result from method for given above list of params.
Pairs (@unittest_params, @unittest_expect) may be repeated as many times as necessary for performing many tests for different sets of parameters. But you remember to put should corresponding @unittest_expect tag definition for each @unittest_params tag. Tags which haven't matching counterparts will be ignored.

Background
First of all this version main aim is to generate also real testing code from information provided by developer in source code.
Previous versions required to create main source code and then switching to test classes, to their code and create real test code. After some changes in basic sources work should be done again. It isn't very bad idea. But it requires to work on one thing in two different places.
I suggest to define/have all in one place. Both basic source code and test code in one file. Of course runnable test code should be separated from source code to prevent from side-effects.
To accomplish such requirements I suggest to write your source code as usual but test code should be defined in JavaDoc comments with special tags. For example for following case: "for set of parameters: (4, 2, 1) extected value is: 10" we can create tags:
@unittest_params 4, 2, 1
@unittest_expect 10
And any parsing utility should be able to extract special tags and generate test code based on given information from developer.

Current implementation offers full control over the generated test code for developers.
